ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part assigns one specific path in the function reference network graph to an implementation. A Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part provides support for exchange of information needed to determine swappability of functions assigned to devices.
the swap_code specifies the string that is the type of exchange that is valid.
the path_alias specifies the string that is the identifier for the Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part.

the of_property specifies the role of the Coordinated_characteristc for the Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part. There may be more than one of_property for a Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part. The of_property need not be specified for a particular Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part.
the implementation specifies the role of the for the Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part.
the functional_design_definition_path specifies the role of the for the Reference_functional_unit_assignment_to_part.

A Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_reference_functional_unit is an assignment of a in a to a in a for the functional definition of a product.
This provides the capability to exchange a functional decomposition that an enterprise reuses in multiple designs.
The library functional hierarchy, if provided, is required to be a network definition with the constraint that only external references on the root node of the network structure will be mapped to physical terminals of the reused product design.
The allocation relationship in this Application Object is critical in mapping between a functional design and a physical implementation of that design, because this part of ISO 10303 relies on the reference mapping between a functional definition in a library and the physical implementation of that functional definition in that library, usually in a packaged part, to identify the necessary definitions that need to be instantiated in the physical design.
the design_definition_path specifies the for the Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_reference_functional_unit.
the reference_definition_path specifies the for the Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_reference_functional_unit.
A Reference_composition_path is one path through the function reference network graph.
the reference_functional_unit specifies the that participates as a link to the leaf node in the functional decomposition hierarchical definition in the Reference_composition_path.
the path_element specifies the role of the for the Reference_composition_path. There shall be one or more for a Reference_composition_path.

A Component_swap_specification is a type of . The Component_swap_specification specifies which component has been swapped for which other component in a design; both the swapped-out and the swapped-in components are specified.
The Component_swap_specification supports the component identification portion of the gate swap specification. It is necessary when components, such as the microcircuits known as U1, U2, etc. are being swapped.
the previous_design_object specifies the for the original design object before swapping, for the Component_swap_specification.
the current_design_object specifies the for the resulting design object after swapping, for the Component_swap_specification.

A Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component may be a . A Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component is the relationship between the and the that performs the required function.
the swap_code specifies the text that is the type of replacement that is valid.

the path_alias specifies the label that is the identifier in the context of the implementation for the Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component.
"A", "B", "C", "D", are typical path_alias for a quad NAND gate part.

the of_property specifies the Coordinated_characteristc for the Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component. There may be more than one of_property for a Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component. The of_property need not be specified for a particular Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component.
the local_swappable specifies a boolean value that indicates if occurrences of the associated path can be exchanged within the context of an .
the global_swappable specifies a boolean value that indicates if occurrences of the associated path can be exchanged within the context of an being designed.
the implementation specifies the for the Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component.
the functional_design_definition_path specifies the for the Design_functional_unit_allocation_to_assembly_component.

A Design_composition_path is a collection of that together compose one path through the complete functional definition that has the design_functional_unit as a reference to the that is the leaf node. The functional definition has a root node that is a . The path is then established by starting at the leaf element and traversing the collection of path_element in the sequence in which they exist in the functional definition between the leaf element and the root element. Each member of path_element establishes a link in the sequence. The Design_composition_path is a mapping source for a packaging application to use to map between a hierarchical description and a flattened description of a network.
The types of node elements that are composing a directed acyclic graph must be consistent. This part of ISO 10303 uses as the node elements.
the design_functional_unit specifies the for the leaf element for the Design_composition_path.
the path_element specifies the for the Design_composition_path. There shall be one or more for a Design_composition_path.

A Gate_path_swap_specification is a type of . This entity explicitly states that a path to a functional unit in a design shall be changed to a new path in the library of functional unit definitions.
Normally the new path is based on the same root functional unit definition in the library, leading to a different path in the same technology, but there is no restriction in the standard that prohibits switching to a different functional unit definition in the library. If there is a new functional unit definition as root, other design changes will likely need to occur, but the mapping to identify those explicitly and relate them to this entity is not standardized, except through the use of the requirement_occurrence concept. Specifically, this entity needs to be used in conjunction with the component swap specification to swap between components if the path in the library is also changing.
An example is in the case where a change is being made from one microcircuit and its terminal, U1-A, to another microcircuit and terminal, U2-C.
the previous_design_object specifies the from which the swap was made in the Gate_path_swap_specification.
the current_design_object specifies the that results from the swap in the Gate_path_swap_specification.

A Terminal_swap_specification is a type of . The Terminal_swap_specification is part of the swapping specification from the previous design definition to the current design definition. It identifies the terminal in the previous design that was connected to a node, and the terminal in the current design that is connected to that node instead.
With the pin mapping between the functional and physical representations in the library, this is sufficient information to derive the swapping at the component terminal; however, note that this is in the previous and present design definitions and not in the library functional definition.
the current_design_object specifies the of the terminal node after the swap for the Terminal_swap_specification.
the previous_design_object specifies the of the terminal node before the swap for the Terminal_swap_specification.
